name: Great Basin National Park
description: From the 13,063-foot summit of Wheeler Peak to the sagebrush-covered foothills, Great Basin National Park hosts a sample of the incredible diversity of the larger Great Basin region. Come and partake of the solitude of the wilderness, walk among ancient bristlecone pines, bask in the darkest of night skies, and explore mysterious subterranean passages. There's a lot more than just desert here.
shortDescription: From the 13,063-foot summit of Wheeler Peak to the sagebrush-covered foothills, Great Basin National Park hosts a sample of the incredible diversity of the larger Great Basin region. Come and partake ...

operatingHours.description:
Park Grounds and Trails

Check "Visitor Centers" tab for facility-specific hours

climate.weatherDescription: There is almost an 8,000 ft (2,400 m) difference in elevation between Wheeler Peak and the valley floor. Weather conditions in the park vary with elevation. In late spring and early summer, days in the valley may be hot, yet the snow pack may not have melted in the higher elevations. The Great Basin is a desert, with low relative humidity and sharp drops in temperature at night. In the summer, fierce afternoon thunderstorms are common. It can snow any time of the year at high elevations.

images.title: Wheeler cirque
images.altText: blue sky with green trees in mountain cirque
images.caption: Trail to ancient bristlecone pine trees.

images.title: Bristlecone at night
images.altText: Bristlecone pine tree with a dark blue sky behind it with a bright Jupiter shining
images.caption: Planets like Jupiter shine bright at Great Basin

images.title: Lehman Caves Grand Palace Parachute formation
images.altText: Brown and tan cave formation in the shape of a parachute
images.caption: Lehman Caves of Great Basin National Park offers incredible views of a rare subterranean world.

images.title: Milky Way at Great Basin National Park
images.altText: Colorful Milky Way over the red lit Lehman Caves Visitor Center
images.caption: Come see the Milky Way at Great Basin National Park. Remember to check the moon phase.

images.title: Great Basin Visitor Center
images.altText: Tan and green Visitor center with mountains in the background.
images.caption: Great Basin Visitor Center just six miles from the park entrance

images.title: Alpine Flowers
images.altText: White, yellow,, and pink alpine flowers.
images.caption: Flowers grow even at the high altitudes of the Great Basin National Park

images.title: Golden Eagle
images.altText: Golden Eagle flying with wings spread wide
images.caption: Wildlife is abundant at Great Basin National Park including birds, deer, fish, and mountain lion.

images.title: Snow Covered Mountains
images.altText: Snow covered mountains with brown trees in the foreground
images.caption: Snow can come early, even in the fall at Great Basin.

images.title: Comet NEOWISE
images.altText: Ancient bristlecone with comet NEOWISE in the background
images.caption: Great Basin National Park offers truly dark-skies that rarely seen within the United States.
